entry.title: Different list of entries in app settings for manage planned orders (F4170)
entry.content:
Dear community,

there are a few users in department with the same set of roles, except the key user with some additional roles. When they open the app manage planned orders (F4170) they can change the area of responsibility (AOR) in the personal settings. The options look like this:

Now there is a new user with a recently created user account with the same set of roles. He will get a different list of options in the MRP settings, asking for AoR and usage of app F0251A:

What is causing this different list of options? I did not find any hint in the roles and restrictions how to modify the content of the app settings.

Thank you.

Regards,

Dirk

entry.title: Archiving Custom Database Tables in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently working on a data archiving in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I have a few Questions about the Archiving of Custom Database tables.

For SAP standard tables, the process is well-defined and handled via the Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) framework, using standard ILM and archiving objects.

My challenge is with custom-developed database tables. I want to archive data from these tables, but I'm struggling to get the ILM framework to recognize my custom setup.

Here's what I've done so far:

  • I created a custom ILM Object and a corresponding Archiving Object for my custom DB table.

  • However, when I try to configure this ILM Object in the relevant ILM settings, I cannot assign the custom ILM Object to an Audit Area.

This leads to my main questions:

Is the ILM Framework fully supported and suitable for custom-developed tables and data archiving in SAP Public Cloud?

If yes, where can i configure the missing settings, so that the ILM Framework recognizes my ILM Object?

If ILM is not the recommended path for custom tables, what are the alternatives for archiving?

I'm considering the use of the Document Management Service (DMS) 

  1. Is DMS a viable storage for archived structured data?

  2. If so, would the data need to be converted into a specific document format (like XML or JSON) before being stored.

  3. Are there any best practices or recommended services/APIs in the Public Cloud specifically designed for archiving custom, structured business data outside of the standard ILM flow?

Any insights from someone who has successfully implemented archiving for custom solutions in the SAP Public Cloud would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Budget EAC/ ETC for entreprise projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

As part of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  project, I would like to present the identified open points, the investigations carried out, and the potential solutions I have considered. I would also like to know if there are standard alternatives to address these needs

Identified Issues

  • Unavailability of EAC* (Estimate at Completion) and ETC* (Estimate to Complete) functionalities for enterprise projects in SAP Cloud Public
  • Finding a solution to manually enter the initial budget budget without using the CSV file (scope item 1HB)

Investigation and Proposed Solutions

For the first point (EAC/ETC):

  • Excel: Export budget data from SAP Public Cloud and calculate EAC and ETC using formulas.
  • Custom CDS Views: Create custom views to extract the necessary data (committed costs, remaining costs) and perform calculations outside SAP.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): Build dashboards incorporating EAC and ETC calculations.
  • Adding specific fields: Create two new data points (EAC and ETC) in reporting, which would require custom development.
  • Implementing service projects: Considered as an option, but raises integration issues with production and logistics.

For the second point (initial budget):

  • We have only found the solution via CSV upload.

Questions

Are there standard functionalities or recommended best practices in SAP Public Cloud to:

  • Calculate and display EAC and ETC in enterprise projects?
  • Enter the initial budget manually without using the CSV file?

Thanks

entry.title: how to debug implementation of BADI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL in S4 Public cloud
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've implemented BADI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL on flexible workflow approval but now I would like to check if this is working as expected and analyse real values passed by SAP. Theoricaly, it should work, but a better understanding of variable content during real execution may help me to prevent some unexpected situation.

I've wound some info for on premise/ private implementation of S/4, but nothing for S/4 public cloud.

As the processing of workflow is triggered asynchronously with a technical user, please help on how we can setup debug mode during execution.

Regards,

Pierre

entry.title: Enable Posting of Supplier Invoices with Zero Amount
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are currently working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and we have a business requirement to post Supplier Invoices with a Gross Amount of zero (0.00). This scenario occurs, for example, when receiving "Free of Charge" items where only VAT needs to be recorded, or when posting clearing invoices that balance to zero.

How can we make this?

Thanks.

entry.title: Issue with Unit of Measure Mapping in Document and Report Compliance for Colombia (DIAN Requirements
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently configuring Document and Report Compliance (DRC) for Colombia in an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementation, and we encountered an issue related to the Unit of Measure (UoM) mapping during electronic invoice generation.

While generating the invoice XML, the system retrieves the Unit_OF_Measure code from the value mapping configuration. However, we noticed that several standard SAP UoMs do not have a direct equivalent in the fiscal authority’s database (DIAN).

For example:

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the unit “PI – Piece” exists and is commonly used in logistics and sales processes.

  • However, in the DIAN catalog, there is no unit of measure for “piece”, only options like DPC (Dozen Pieces) and other grouped units.

This creates a mismatch, since the SAP standard UoM does not appear in the official DIAN list, and therefore it is not clear how we should properly map these units to comply with DIAN’s required XML structure.

My questions are:

  1. How should we handle UoM mapping in DRC when the DIAN catalog does not include a direct equivalent for SAP standard units such as PI (Piece)?

  2. Is there an SAP-recommended approach or a standard mapping table for Colombia that aligns S/4HANA Cloud UoMs with DIAN-approved UoMs?

  3. Is it possible (or recommended) to create a custom mapping in Value Mapping for units not listed by DIAN, or must we adapt the business process to use only DIAN-supported units?

  4. Has anyone faced this issue in previous Colombian DRC implementations, and what was the accepted solution?

Any guidance or reference to official SAP notes or documentation for Colombia’s DRC unit-of-measure mapping would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!
